questions.question: ………………………. park in front of the shop.
questions.description: The subject of an imperative sentence is always you. Hence, we use do.

questions.question: ………………………… your shoes off before entering the temple.
questions.description: We use a plural verb in imperative sentences.

questions.question: The world will run out of oil unless it ……………………………………. conservation.
questions.description: In the first conditional, use a simple present tense in the subordinate clause and will + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: The police are looking for a woman who ……………………………. her children.
She …………………………… on a new project at the moment.
questions.description: The present continuous is used to talk about actions or situations that are going on around now.

questions.question: She ……………………………… to him for twenty years.
questions.description: The present perfect is commonly used with the time expressions for and since to show duration.

questions.question: My cat ……………………………. for over three weeks now.
If you had been careful, you ……………………………….. yourself.
questions.description: In third conditional, use a past perfect tense in the if clause and would have + past participle in the main clause.

questions.question: As soon as she ……………………………. I told her the news.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the past tense, use a past tense in the subordinate clause as well.

questions.question: The old woman …………………………… alone.
questions.description: The simple present is used to talk about permanent situations.

questions.question: I asked him if he …………………………….. my cat.
